subject: Relationships
title: How to Safety-Plan an Exit
description: One-minute skill: How to Safety-Plan an Exit.

hook.text: Leaving is the most dangerous time. 75% of domestic violence murders happen during or after separation.

buildup.text: Safety planning includes: saving money secretly, documenting abuse, identifying safe contacts, and timing the exit.

discovery.text: National hotlines provide free, confidential safety planning. Advocates help create personalized exit strategies.

twist.text: Leaving isn't one dramatic moment. It's a gradual, strategic process that prioritizes physical and emotional safety.

climax.text: Asking for help isn't weakness. It's the most courageous thing a person in a toxic relationship can do.

punchline.text: Leaving a toxic relationship takes planning, not just courage. Safety first.

quiz.question: When is the most dangerous time in an abusive relationship?
